summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) personnel discussing how to handle document requests from Jeffrey Epstein's defense team following his death. The requests, sent by the law firm Steptoe & Johnson, are related to Epstein's death and are being routed for assignment to an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA).

events.title: Defense Team Submits Document Requests
events.description: Epstein's defense lawyers at Steptoe & Johnson send formal document requests to the U.S. Attorney's Office, the FBI, and the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding Epstein's death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The document references that Epstein has died and that the defense requests are related to his death, indicating it occurred prior to this correspondence.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense team, led by Steptoe & Johnson, was actively seeking documents related to his death from the USAO, FBI, and MCC as of August 20, 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office internally debated how to handle these posthumous requests, noting there was 'no right to anything given that there is no proceeding pending related to the death.'
The correspondence shows the USAO intended to assign a new matter (2019V01791) to an AUSA to handle these 'Touhy requests' (requests for testimony or documents from federal employees).
The underlying criminal case is identified as United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19-CRIM-00490 (S.D.N.Y.).
